overview_summary: Adjacent landowners include a historic 28,000-acre cattle ranch held by the conservation-focused Brophy family, a small RV park owned by an out-of-town family trust, and a private family trust parcel. The ranch owners have significant local clout and have moved to block development via conservation easements, suggesting a cautious or oppositional stance toward new projects. The RV park proprietors are less influential but rely on preserving the area’s quiet, scenic character, so they may resist disruptive development, while the Klein family trust’s position remains unknown.

neighbors.name: Babacomari Ranch Company
neighbors.claims: Babacomari Ranch Company is a family-owned cattle ranch (~28,000 acres) in southeastern Arizona, established via an 1832 land grant and acquired by Frank C. Brophy in 1935 [Arizona Land and Water Trust](https://alwt.org/babacomari-ranch/). The Brophy family has operated the ranch since 1935 and in 2023 partnered with a land trust to place 2,488 acres under a permanent conservation easement, ensuring no non-agricultural development on that portion of the ranch [Arizona Land and Water Trust](https://alwt.org/babacomari-ranch/). A Brophy family member publicly criticized the region’s 'mish-mash development and growth' and emphasized using easements to protect the ranch from 'rapid development'[ARIZONA LAND AND WATER TRUST†L50-L54】. Beneficial ownership resides with the Brophy family (descendants of Frank Brophy) and no other parent entity is involved [Arizona Land and Water Trust](https://alwt.org/babacomari-ranch/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Largest private landowner in area (28,000 acres); multi-generational local family with conservation ties; able to leverage resources and partnerships (e.g., with Land Trust and federal programs)

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Brophy family through a conservation lens – emphasize minimal environmental impact and potential habitat enhancements; highlight alignment with Fort Huachuca’s interests. Outreach via trusted intermediaries (e.g., Arizona Land and Water Trust) may build goodwill given the family’s stewardship values.

neighbors.name: Mountain View RV Resort LLC
neighbors.claims: Mountain View RV Resort LLC is a domestic Arizona LLC formed on April 3, 2020, and it is managed by Ronald D. Moore and Lori B. Moore with the Moore Family Revocable Trust as the sole member/owner [Arizona Corporation Commission](https://ecorp.azcc.gov/BusinessSearch/BusinessInfo?entityNumber=23075182). The LLC operates the Mountain View RV Park (99 W Vista Ln, Huachuca City) catering to campers and 'snowbirds'; the park’s marketing highlights 'wide-open desert skies' and 'quiet nights' as key attractions [Mountain View RV Park](https://mountainviewrvpark.com/). The owners have not taken any public stance on local development proposals; however, given their business’s reliance on a peaceful, scenic environment, they would likely oppose projects that introduce significant noise, light, or disturb the desert views [Mountain View RV Park](https://mountainviewrvpark.com/).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small business (3-acre RV campground) with limited economic or political weight; owners are not local residents (reside in Graham County) and have no noted involvement in community leadership

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out personally to the Moore family (owners) emphasizing that project construction and operation will be low-impact (no excessive noise or light) and potentially bring patronage (e.g., construction workers or eco-tourists) to their RV park; address any concerns about views or access early to prevent opposition.
